title: Pressure - force on a submerged submarine

content.question: A submarine whose top surface has an area of <math alttext="7500 square meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7500</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> is at a depth of <math alttext="4000 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4000</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> below the surface of the ocean. Ocean water has a density of <math alttext="1025 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1025</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></math>. The force exerted on the top surface of the submarine by the water is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="5.48 times 10 to the third power newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.48</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mtext>10</mtext><mtext>3</mtext></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></math>

<math alttext="4.11 times 10 to the 7 power newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.11</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mtext>10</mtext><mn>7</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></math>

<math alttext="7.70 times 10 to the 7 power newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7.70</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mtext>10</mtext><mn>7</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></math>

<math alttext="3.08 times 10 to the 11 power newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.08</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mtext>10</mtext><mn>11</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3.08 times 10 to the 11 power newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.08</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mtext>10</mtext><mn>11</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
